cheatsheet.title: Performance Investigator Setup for Remote Profiling

intro.description: Follow these steps to enable and start remote profiling on a target device. To open a related help page for more specific information, click the question mark icon at the end of the task title row.

item.title: Install Nokia PC Suite on the PC.
item.description: Install the latest Nokia PC Suite on your PC and launch Carbide.c++ IDE.

item.title: Connect a USB cable.
item.description: Connect a USB cable to the PC and then to the target device.

item.title: Start the Performance Investigator Import Wizard
item.description: Start the Import Wizard in Carbide.c++ by selecting Carbide > Performance Investigator

item.title: Import data from device by tracing
item.description: On the Select Profiler Data Files page, select to get profiler data From Device via TraceViewer.

item.title: Check connection settings
item.description: Before you start tracing, check the connections settings. Select Connection settings to open the TraceViewer Connections Setting dialog. After checking and saving the connection settings, click Refresh Plug-ins List. If the connection to the target device is working correctly, a list of the available plug-ins appears.

item.title: Set plug-ins for tracing and prefix for created file.
item.description: Select the plug-ins you want to trace from Select Plug-ins for Tracing list Enter the file prefix to be used for the trace data file.

item.title: Run the trace.
item.description: Click Start Tracing to begin and carry out the use case with your application. When you are finished with the use case, click Stop Tracing. A new trace file name appears in the Created Profiler Data Fileslist. If you wish you can run another trace. Just enter a new prefix for the second file and change the setting if you wish.

item.title: Finish the import
item.description: Click Next to continue with the import. For detailed instructions, click the question mark icon to open the Help.

item.title: Open the file for analysis
item.description: If you imported only one file, the data will open directly to the PI Analyser view. If you imported several files, they will be listed in the PI view and you can double click on an item to view and analyse it in PI Analyzer.
